title: 2021 Clásica de Almería
text:
The 2021 Clásica de Almería was the 36th edition of the <a href="Cl%C3%A1sica%20de%20Almer%C3%ADa">Clásica de Almería</a> road cycling one day race. It was held on 14 February 2021 as part of the <a href="2021%20UCI%20Europe%20Tour">2021 UCI Europe Tour</a> and the <a href="2021%20UCI%20ProSeries">2021 UCI ProSeries</a>. The 183.3-kilometer race started in and finish in <a href="Roquetas%20de%20Mar">Roquetas de Mar</a>.
German sprinter <a href="Pascal%20Ackermann">Pascal Ackermann</a> of , who had won the <a href="2020%20Cl%C3%A1sica%20de%20Almer%C3%ADa">previous</a> <a href="2019%20Cl%C3%A1sica%20de%20Almer%C3%ADa">two</a> editions of the race, did not return to defend his title and missed the opportunity to go for three wins in a row. In his absence, defending <a href="2020%20European%20Road%20Championships">European champion</a> <a href="Giacomo%20Nizzolo">Giacomo Nizzolo</a> of won the sprint ahead of <a href="Florian%20S%C3%A9n%C3%A9chal">Florian Sénéchal</a> of , with Ackermann's teammate <a href="Martin%20Laas">Martin Laas</a> completing the podium.
Teams.
Eleven <a href="UCI%20WorldTeam">UCI WorldTeam</a>s and eleven <a href="UCI%20Professional%20Continental">UCI ProTeam</a>s make up the twenty-two teams that participated in the race. Each team entered seven riders, for a total of 154 riders, of which 143 finished.
